SEARCH
Module com.example.loginpage
Package com.example.loginpage.module.books.typeofbooks

Class AllegoricalBook

java.lang.Object
com.example.loginpage.module.books.Book
com.example.loginpage.module.books.typeofbooks.AllegoricalBook
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public non-sealed class AllegoricalBook extends Book
Represents a book classified under the allegorical genre that employs allegory as a primary narrative device. This non-sealed class can be further extended to accommodate more specific types of allegorical works. This class extends Book, It adds a property to store the type of allegory used, enhancing its narrative and thematic depth.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • AllegoricalBook

      public AllegoricalBook(int id, String title, String author, int year, String genre, String description, String imageSrc, int votes, String allegoryType)
      Constructs a new AllegoricalBook with detailed book information and the type of allegory employed. Initializes all fields with the provided values, highlighting the allegorical narrative technique.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the book.
      title - The title of the book.
      author - The author of the book.
      year - The publication year of the book.
      genre - The genre of the book, typically set to "Allegorical".
      description - A brief description of the book, outlining its allegorical elements.
      imageSrc - A URL or path to an image of the book's cover.
      votes - The number of votes or ratings the book has received.
      allegoryType - A description of the specific type of allegory used in the book.

    • AllegoricalBook

      public AllegoricalBook()
      Default constructor for creating an AllegoricalBook with uninitialized fields. This constructor sets up a new AllegoricalBook instance without initializing its properties, including the allegory type.

  • Method Details

    • getAllegoryType

      public String getAllegoryType()
      Retrieves the type of allegory used in the book.
      Returns:
      The type of allegory employed.

    • setAllegoryType

      public void setAllegoryType(String allegoryType)
      Sets the type of allegory used in the book.
      Parameters:
      allegoryType - The new type of allegory to be used in the book.

    • printInfo

      public void printInfo()
      Prints detailed information about the AllegoricalBook, including its general information and the type of allegory employed. This method overrides the printInfo method from the Book superclass to add specific information about the allegorical genre.
      Overrides:
      printInfo in class Book

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a string representation of the AllegoricalBook, including the type of allegory used. This method appends the allegory type information to the string representation provided by the Book superclass.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Book
      Returns:
      A string representation of the AllegoricalBook, including details about the type of allegory employed.
